lobstr 1.1.1.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Inspect an object

Source: R/sxp.R
sxp.Rd

sxp(x) is similar to .Internal(inspect(x)), recursing into the C data structures underlying any R object. The main difference is the output is a little more compact, it recurses fully, and avoids getting stuck in infinite loops by using a depth-first search. It also returns a list that you can compute with, and carefully uses colour to highlight the most important details.

sxp(x, expand = character(), max_depth = 5L)

Arguments

x

Object to inspect
expand

Optionally, expand components of the true that are usually suppressed. Use:

  • "character" to show underlying entries in the global string pool.

  • "environment" to show the underlying hashtables.

  • "altrep" to show the underlying data.

  • "call" to show the full AST (but ast() is usually superior)

  • "bytecode" to show generated bytecode.
max_depth

Maximum depth to recurse. Use max_depth = Inf (with care!) to recurse as deeply as possible. Skipped elements will be shown as ....`

Details

The name sxp comes from SEXP, the name of the C data structure that underlies all R objects.

See also

Other object inspectors: ast(), ref()

Examples

x <- list(
  TRUE,
  1L,
  runif(100),
  "3"
)
sxp(x)

#> [1:0x7fb94122f548] <VECSXP[4]> (named:4)
#>   [2:0x7fb941e6cb00] <LGLSXP[1]> (named:3)
#>   [3:0x7fb941e6cb38] <INTSXP[1]> (named:3)
#>   [4:0x7fb940f45b10] <REALSXP[100]> (named:1)
#>   [5:0x7fb941e6cba8] <STRSXP[1]> (named:3)

# Expand "character" to see underlying CHARSXP entries in the global
# string pool
x <- c("banana", "banana", "apple", "banana")
sxp(x)

#> [1:0x7fb94310dab8] <STRSXP[4]> (named:4)
sxp(x, expand = "character")

#> [1:0x7fb94310dab8] <STRSXP[4]> (named:4)
#>   [2:0x7fb941e7d430] <CHARSXP> (named:10)
#>   [2:0x7fb941e7d430]
#>   [3:0x7fb941e7d4d8] <CHARSXP> (named:4)
#>   [2:0x7fb941e7d430]

# Expand altrep to see underlying data
x <- 1:10
sxp(x)

#> [1:0x7fb942abbc30] <INTSXP[10]> (altrep named:65535)
sxp(x, expand = "altrep")

#> [1:0x7fb942abbc30] <INTSXP[10]> (altrep named:65535)
#>   _class [2:0x7fb93bc09090] <RAWSXP[144]> (named:3355)
#>     _attrib [3:0x7fb93c043a50] <LISTSXP> (named:1)
#>       [4:0x7fb93c043c80] <SYMSXP: compact_intseq> (named:31)
#>       [5:0x7fb93c00d210] <SYMSXP: base> (named:65535)
#>       [6:0x7fb93c0417e8] <INTSXP[1]> (named:2)
#>   _data1 [7:0x7fb942968df8] <REALSXP[3]> (named:1)
#>   _data2 <NILSXP>

# Expand environmnets to see the underlying implementation details
e1 <- new.env(hash = FALSE, parent = emptyenv(), size = 3L)
e2 <- new.env(hash = TRUE, parent = emptyenv(), size = 3L)
e1$x <- e2$x <- 1:10

sxp(e1)

#> [1:0x7fb9412f45c0] <ENVSXP> (named:5)
#>   x [2:0x7fb9413642e8] <INTSXP[10]> (altrep named:65535)
#>   _enclos [3:0x7fb93c00e4a8] <ENVSXP: empty> (named:65535)
sxp(e1, expand = "environment")

#> [1:0x7fb9412f45c0] <ENVSXP> (named:6)
#>   _frame [2:0x7fb941363cc8] <LISTSXP> (named:1)
#>     x [3:0x7fb9413642e8] <INTSXP[10]> (altrep named:65535)
#>   _hashtab <NILSXP>
#>   _enclos [5:0x7fb93c00e4a8] <ENVSXP: empty> (named:65535)
sxp(e2, expand = "environment")

#> [1:0x7fb94132c198] <ENVSXP> (named:5)
#>   _frame <NILSXP>
#>   _hashtab [3:0x7fb9431c41d8] <VECSXP[3/1]> (named:1)
#>     [4:0x7fb941363fd8] <LISTSXP> (named:1)
#>       x [5:0x7fb9413642e8] <INTSXP[10]> (altrep named:65535)
#>     <NILSXP>
#>     <NILSXP>
#>   _enclos [6:0x7fb93c00e4a8] <ENVSXP: empty> (named:65535)
